title: Leading causes of death among black U.S. residents in 2017
yAxis: Percentage of all causes of death
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of all causes of death for 10 number of Months.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
The highest value at Month Diseases of the heart is 11.65x times more than the lowest value at Septicemia.
min_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Percentage of all causes of death in each Month on the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of all causes of death for 10 number of Months.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
The highest value at Month Diseases of the heart is 11.65x times more than the lowest value at Septicemia.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
Month Malignant neoplasms (cancers) has the second highest value for Percentage of all causes of death.
The highest Month Diseases of the heart has 21.3 more Percentage of all causes of death than the lowest Month Septicemia.
Percentage of all causes of death at Month Diseases of the heart is 23.3 , second place is Malignant neoplasms (cancers) at 20.8, and thirdly is Accidents (unintentional injuries) at 5.9.
Over the past 10 Months, the Percentage of all causes of death has reduced.
Considered together, the average Percentage of all causes of death in all 10 Months is roughly 7.39.

data.Month: Nephritis nephrotic syndrome and nephrosis (kidney diseases)
